channel.title: Letting Others Connect
channel.description:
Hello, I'm currently trying to re-setup a private server after I quit for a while, and now I cannot do it. I've port-fowarded, and allowed all programs that prevent ports from connecting to allow them. I do have a server running, and it was up when I tried to add it to the server page, although I keep getting the error;
The server [i][b]name[/b][/i] is offline, it must be online before you can register it here.
I triple-checked that I have entered the correct IP and made checked that it was my IP with the command ipconfig in the command prompt. I have tried it with and without using no-ip or other redirecting services. I am using a Linksys Wireless Router and its model number is WMP54G v4.3 which [u][i]isn't[/i][/u] on portfowarding.com, and I have no reason to why it isn't as it is just like all the other Linksys routers on there.. unless the fact that its a PCI adapter makes it different, and I wouldnt see why because.. I don't know what a "PCI" is. I've done everything to correct as I have done this before, but I have no clue what to do now. I'll post pictures below to help. This is an image of my router information. [img]http://img185.imageshack.us/img185/6471/routersl7.png[/img] This is an image of the port-fowarding section from 192.168.1.1 [img]http://img242.imageshack.us/img242/9954/appngmngsb2.png[/img] This is an image of the security section from 192.168.1.1 [img]http://img519.imageshack.us/img519/8384/sectyuu7.png[/img] Please note that the question seems a little vague, but I don't know any more information that could possbily be the problem, so I'm sorry I can't ellaborate unless you ask a question. I've honestly tried and made sure everything was perfect that had to be correct. I think I honestly need help from a more computer-literate person. Thanks in advance.

item.title: Letting Others Connect
item.dc:creator: @united0wnage united0wnage
item.description:
@united0wnage wrote:

k hold on[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 13, 2008, 12:43:29 AM[/size][hr][quote=“just1nkr3d1bl3, post:1, topic:219854”]Hello, I’m currently trying to re-setup a private server after I quit for a while, and now I cannot do it. I’ve port-fowarded, and allowed all programs that prevent ports from connecting to allow them. I do have a server running, and it was up when I tried to add it to the server page, although I keep getting the error;

The server name is offline, it must be online before you can register it here.

I triple-checked that I have entered the correct IP and made checked that it was my IP with the command ipconfig in the command prompt. I have tried it with and without using no-ip or other redirecting services. I am using a Linksys Wireless Router and its model number is WMP54G v4.3 which isn’t on portfowarding.com, and I have no reason to why it isn’t as it is just like all the other Linksys routers on there… unless the fact that its a PCI adapter makes it different, and I wouldnt see why because… I don’t know what a “PCI” is.

I’ve done everything to correct as I have done this before, but I have no clue what to do now. I’ll post pictures below to help.

This is an image of my router information.

This is an image of the port-fowarding section from 192.168.1.1

  • make the .1 .111
    This is an image of the security section from 192.168.1.1

Please note that the question seems a little vague, but I don’t know any more information that could possbily be the problem, so I’m sorry I can’t ellaborate unless you ask a question. I’ve honestly tried and made sure everything was perfect that had to be correct. I think I honestly need help from a more computer-literate person. Thanks in advance.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @just1nkr3d1bl3 just1nkr3d1bl3
item.description:
@just1nkr3d1bl3 wrote:

This is what it says, (with the suffix /all to ipconfig [bringing ipconfig/all])

Ethernet adapter Wireless Network Connection:

    Connection-specific DNS Suffix  . :
    Description . . . . . . . . . . . : Linksys Wireless-G PCI Adapter
    Physical Address. . . . . . . . . : 00-0F-66-76-A7-04
    Dhcp Enabled. . . . . . . . . . . : Yes
    Autoconfiguration Enabled . . . . : Yes
    IP Address. . . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.111
    Subnet Mask . . . . . . . . . . . : 255.255.255.0
    Default Gateway . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.1
    DHCP Server . . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.1.1
    DNS Servers . . . . . . . . . . . : 167.206.254.2
                                        167.206.254.1
    Lease Obtained. . . . . . . . . . : Sunday, July 13, 2008 1:13:08 AM
    Lease Expires . . . . . . . . . . : Monday, July 14, 2008 1:13:08 AM

item.title: Letting Others Connect
item.dc:creator: @just1nkr3d1bl3 just1nkr3d1bl3
item.description:
@just1nkr3d1bl3 wrote:

Thanks, I’ve tried 192.168.1.111, and 192.168.1.1 seeing as 192.168.1.1 is my Default Gateway I doubted that it’d work.

item.title: Letting Others Connect
item.dc:creator: @united0wnage united0wnage
item.description:
@united0wnage wrote:

go to

start>programs>accesories>commandprompt> then type ipconig check your ipaddress

it can be 192.168.1.1 or it may be like 192.168.1.101 like mine you have to change in the port forwarded part 101 instead of 1

that’s what my problem was. and if you’re using a no-ip make sure its up and running. xD

Read full topic
